name: Link
description: A link component that allows users to navigate to related content, either within the current page, elsewhere on the site, or on external sites. Supports configurable styles, states, and icon positioning.

text.description: Link text content. Can be empty for icon-only links.

title.description: Title attribute for the link providing additional context

is_new_window.description: Open link in a new window/tab with target='_blank'

is_external.description: Indicates if the link is external, adds external styling and icon

is_active.description: Indicates if the link is in an active state

is_disabled.description: Indicates if the link is disabled and non-interactive

icon.description: Icon name from the CivicTheme icon set

icon_group_disabled.description: Disable icon and last word grouping functionality

icon_single_only.description: Only show 1 icon (if both icon and is_external are present, external takes preference)

examples.name: External link
examples.description: Link to external site with icon

examples.name: Link with icon
examples.description: Link with custom icon before text

examples.name: Icon-only link
examples.description: Link with only an icon, no text

when_to_use: Connect users to related content or functionality
Provide navigation between pages within your website
Direct users to external resources or websites
Create in-page navigation to different sections
Provide supplementary information without disrupting the primary content flow
when_not_to_use: The action will change or manipulate data - use a button instead
The interaction initiates a process or workflow - use a button instead
Multiple actions are required in a form - use buttons to clearly indicate submission and cancellation
The primary call to action needs to be emphasised - consider using a button which has greater visual prominence
Text simply needs emphasis without navigation - use appropriate text styling instead
best_practices: Write link text that clearly describes where the link will take the user
Keep link text concise but descriptive enough to make sense when read out of context
Maintain consistent styling for links throughout your site
Implement all link states (default, hover, active, focus, visited)
Clearly indicate when a link will take users to an external site
Use underlines to help differentiate links from surrounding text
Ensure sufficient contrast against background (4.5:1 minimum)
Provide visible focus indicators that meet WCAG 2.2 standards

wcag_issues: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A): Links that open in new tab/window should alert the user
notes: External links automatically get 'Opens in a new tab/window' screen reader text when is_new_window is true
Icon-only links get increased padding for better touch targets

known_issues: External link notification: Links opening in new windows should provide clearer user notification
Icon-only accessibility: Icon-only links rely on title attribute which may not be sufficient for all screen readers
Touch target size: Some link configurations may not meet minimum touch target requirements
variations: Content link: Links used within body text content
Navigation link: Links used in navigation and other UI elements with semibold weight

findings: Users expect links to have distinct visual styling (underlines, color changes)
External link indicators improve user confidence and reduce unexpected navigation
Icon placement preferences vary by context but 'after' is generally preferred
Consistent link styling across the site improves user comprehension
